facts.1: National HIV Testing Day was first observed on June 27, 1995.
facts.2: The day aims to encourage people to get tested for HIV and know their status.
facts.3: Early detection of HIV can lead to better health outcomes and reduce the spread of the virus.

facts.1: Helen Keller Day commemorates the birth of Helen Keller on June 27, 1880.
facts.2: Helen Keller was the first deaf-blind person to earn a Bachelor of Arts degree.
facts.3: The day celebrates her achievements and raises awareness about the challenges faced by people with disabilities.

facts.1: Sunglasses Day is celebrated to promote the importance of wearing sunglasses to protect eyes from harmful UV rays.
facts.2: The first sunglasses were invented in China in the 12th century.
facts.3: Modern sunglasses were popularized by Hollywood stars in the 1920s and 1930s.
